flag.name: dn_rpc_address
flag.meaning: Datatype: String Could set 127.0.0.1(for local test) or ipv4 address

flag.name: dn_rpc_port
flag.meaning: Used for connection of IoTDB native clients(Session) Bind with dn_rpc_address Datatype: int

flag.name: dn_internal_address
flag.meaning: Datatype: String could set 127.0.0.1(for local test) or ipv4 address.

flag.name: dn_internal_port
flag.meaning: Used for communication inside cluster. Bind with dn_internal_address Datatype: int

flag.name: dn_mpp_data_exchange_port
flag.meaning: Port for data exchange among DataNodes inside cluster Bind with dn_internal_address Datatype: int

flag.name: dn_schema_region_consensus_port
flag.meaning: port for consensus's communication for schema region inside cluster. Bind with dn_internal_address Datatype: int

flag.name: dn_data_region_consensus_port
flag.meaning: port for consensus's communication for data region inside cluster. Bind with dn_internal_address Datatype: int

flag.name: dn_join_cluster_retry_interval_ms
flag.meaning: Datatype: long The time of data node waiting for the next retry to join into the cluster.

flag.name: dn_target_config_node_list
flag.meaning: Target Config Nodes For the first ConfigNode to start, cn_target_config_node_list points to its own cn_internal_address:cn_internal_port. For other ConfigNodes that to join the cluster, target_config_node_list points to any running ConfigNode's cn_internal_address:cn_internal_port. Format: address:port(,address:port)* e.g. 127.0.0.1:22277,127.0.0.1:22279 Datatype: String

flag.name: dn_system_dir
flag.meaning: Directory Configuration system dir If this property is unset, system will save the data in the default relative path directory under the IoTDB folder(i.e., %IOTDB_HOME%/data/datanode/system). If it is absolute, system will save the data in exact location it points to. If it is relative, system will save the data in the relative path directory it indicates under the IoTDB folder. For windows platform If its prefix is a drive specifier followed by "\\", or if its prefix is "\\\\", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative. dn_system_dir=data\\datanode\\system For Linux platform If its prefix is "/", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative.

flag.name: dn_data_dirs
flag.meaning: data dirs If this property is unset, system will save the data in the default relative path directory under the IoTDB folder(i.e., %IOTDB_HOME%/data/datanode/data). If it is absolute, system will save the data in exact location it points to. If it is relative, system will save the data in the relative path directory it indicates under the IoTDB folder. If there are more than one directory, please separate them by commas ",". Note: If data_dirs is assigned an empty string(i.e.,zero-size), it will be handled as a relative path. For windows platform If its prefix is a drive specifier followed by "\\", or if its prefix is "\\\\", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative. dn_data_dirs=data\\datanode\\data For Linux platform If its prefix is "/", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative.

flag.name: dn_multi_dir_strategy
flag.meaning: multi_dir_strategy The strategy is used to choose a directory from data_dirs for the system to store a new tsfile. System provides four strategies to choose from, or user can create his own strategy by extending org.apache.iotdb.db.conf.directories.strategy.DirectoryStrategy. The info of the four strategies are as follows: 1. SequenceStrategy: the system will choose the directory in sequence. 2. MaxDiskUsableSpaceFirstStrategy: the system will choose the directory whose disk has the maximum space. 3. MinFolderOccupiedSpaceFirstStrategy: the system will choose the directory whose folder has the minimum occupied space. 4. RandomOnDiskUsableSpaceStrategy: the system will randomly choose the directory based on usable space of disks. The more usable space, the greater the chance of being chosen; Set SequenceStrategy,MaxDiskUsableSpaceFirstStrategy and MinFolderOccupiedSpaceFirstStrategy to apply the corresponding strategy. If this property is unset, system will use MaxDiskUsableSpaceFirstStrategy as default strategy. For this property, fully-qualified class name (include package name) and simple class name are both acceptable.

flag.name: dn_consensus_dir
flag.meaning: consensus dir If this property is unset, system will save the data in the default relative path directory under the IoTDB folder(i.e., %IOTDB_HOME%/data/datanode). If it is absolute, system will save the data in the exact location it points to. If it is relative, system will save the data in the relative path directory it indicates under the IoTDB folder. Note: If consensus_dir is assigned an empty string(i.e.,zero-size), it will be handled as a relative path. For windows platform If its prefix is a drive specifier followed by "\\", or if its prefix is "\\\\", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative. dn_consensus_dir=data\\datanode\\consensus For Linux platform If its prefix is "/", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative.

flag.name: dn_wal_dirs
flag.meaning: wal dirs If this property is unset, system will save the data in the default relative path directory under the IoTDB folder(i.e., %IOTDB_HOME%/data/datanode). If it is absolute, system will save the data in the exact location it points to. If it is relative, system will save the data in the relative path directory it indicates under the IoTDB folder. If there are more than one directory, please separate them by commas ",". Note: If wal_dirs is assigned an empty string(i.e.,zero-size), it will be handled as a relative path. For windows platform If its prefix is a drive specifier followed by "\\", or if its prefix is "\\\\", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative. dn_wal_dirs=data\\datanode\\wal For Linux platform If its prefix is "/", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative.

flag.name: dn_tracing_dir
flag.meaning: tracing dir Uncomment following fields to configure the tracing root directory. For Window platform, the index is as follows: dn_tracing_dir=datanode\\tracing For Linux platform If its prefix is "/", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative.

flag.name: cn_internal_address
flag.meaning: Datatype: String Could set 127.0.0.1(for local test) or ipv4 address.

flag.name: cn_internal_port
flag.meaning: Used for RPC communication inside cluster. Datatype: int

flag.name: cn_consensus_port
flag.meaning: Used for consensus communication among ConfigNodes inside cluster. Datatype: int

flag.name: cn_target_config_node_list
flag.meaning: Target Config Nodes For the first ConfigNode to start, cn_target_config_node_list points to its own cn_internal_address:cn_internal_port. For other ConfigNodes that to join the cluster, target_config_node_list points to any running ConfigNode's cn_internal_address:cn_internal_port. Format: address:port(,address:port)* e.g. 127.0.0.1:22277,127.0.0.1:22279 Datatype: String

flag.name: cn_system_dir
flag.meaning: Directory configuration system dir If this property is unset, system will save the data in the default relative path directory under the confignode folder(i.e., %CONFIGNODE_HOME%/data/confignode/system). If it is absolute, system will save the data in exact location it points to. If it is relative, system will save the data in the relative path directory it indicates under the confignode folder. For windows platform If its prefix is a drive specifier followed by "\\", or if its prefix is "\\\\", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative. cn_system_dir=data\\confignode\\system For Linux platform If its prefix is "/", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative.

flag.name: cn_consensus_dir
flag.meaning: consensus dir If this property is unset, system will save the data in the default relative path directory under the confignode folder(i.e., %CONFIGNODE_HOME%/data/confignode/consensus). If it is absolute, system will save the data in exact location it points to. If it is relative, system will save the data in the relative path directory it indicates under the confignode folder. Note: If data_dir is assigned an empty string(i.e.,zero-size), it will be handled as a relative path. For windows platform If its prefix is a drive specifier followed by "\\", or if its prefix is "\\\\", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative. cn_consensus_dir=data\\confignode\\consensus For Linux platform If its prefix is "/", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative.

flag.name: cn_rpc_thrift_compression_enable
flag.meaning: thrift rpc configuration this feature is under development, set this as false before it is done. Datatype: boolean

flag.name: cn_rpc_advanced_compression_enable
flag.meaning: if true, a snappy based compression method will be called before sending data by the network Datatype: boolean this feature is under development, set this as false before it is done.

flag.name: cn_rpc_max_concurrent_client_num
flag.meaning: Datatype: int

flag.name: cn_thrift_max_frame_size
flag.meaning: thrift max frame size, 512MB by default Datatype: int

flag.name: cn_thrift_init_buffer_size
flag.meaning: thrift init buffer size Datatype: int

flag.name: cn_connection_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Thrift socket and connection timeout between raft nodes, in milliseconds. Datatype: int

flag.name: cn_selector_thread_nums_of_client_manager
flag.meaning: selector thread (TAsyncClientManager) nums for async thread in a clientManager Datatype: int

flag.name: config_node_consensus_protocol_class
flag.meaning: This parameter is unmodifiable after ConfigNode starts for the first time. These consensus protocols are currently supported: 1. org.apache.iotdb.consensus.ratis.RatisConsensus Datatype: String

flag.name: schema_replication_factor
flag.meaning: Default number of schema replicas Can not be changed after the first start Datatype: int

flag.name: schema_region_consensus_protocol_class
flag.meaning: SchemaRegion consensus protocol type. This parameter is unmodifiable after ConfigNode starts for the first time. These consensus protocols are currently supported: 1. org.apache.iotdb.consensus.simple.SimpleConsensus 2. org.apache.iotdb.consensus.ratis.RatisConsensus Datatype: String

flag.name: data_replication_factor
flag.meaning: Default number of data replicas Can not be changed after the first start Datatype: int

flag.name: data_region_consensus_protocol_class
flag.meaning: DataRegion consensus protocol type. This parameter is unmodifiable after ConfigNode starts for the first time. These consensus protocols are currently supported: 1. org.apache.iotdb.consensus.simple.SimpleConsensus 2. org.apache.iotdb.consensus.multileader.MultiLeaderConsensus 3. org.apache.iotdb.consensus.ratis.RatisConsensus Datatype: String

flag.name: series_partition_slot_num
flag.meaning: Partition (Load balancing) configuration All parameters in Partition configuration is unmodifiable after ConfigNode starts for the first time. And these parameters should be consistent within the ConfigNodeGroup. Number of SeriesPartitionSlots per StorageGroup Datatype: int

flag.name: series_partition_executor_class
flag.meaning: SeriesPartitionSlot executor class These hashing algorithms are currently supported: 1. BKDRHashExecutor(Default) 2. APHashExecutor 3. JSHashExecutor 4. SDBMHashExecutor Also, if you want to implement your own SeriesPartition executor, you can inherit the SeriesPartitionExecutor class and modify this parameter to correspond to your Java class Datatype: String

flag.name: schema_region_per_data_node
flag.meaning: The maximum number of SchemaRegion expected to be managed by each DataNode. Notice: Since each StorageGroup requires at least one SchemaRegion to manage its schema, this parameter doesn't limit the number of SchemaRegions when there are too many StorageGroups. Datatype: Double

flag.name: data_region_per_processor
flag.meaning: The maximum number of DataRegion expected to be managed by each processor. Notice: Since each StorageGroup requires at least two DataRegions to manage its data, this parameter doesn't limit the number of DataRegions when there are too many StorageGroups. Datatype: Double

flag.name: region_allocate_strategy
flag.meaning: Region allocate strategy These allocate strategies are currently supported: 1. GREEDY(Default, when region is allocated, always choose the dataNode that has been allocated the minimum regions) 2. COPY_SET(Random replication according to weight calculated from number of regions on all online dataNodes, suitable for large clusters) Datatype: String

flag.name: routing_policy
flag.meaning: The routing policy of read/write requests These routing policy are currently supported: 1. leader(Default, routing to leader replica) 2. greedy(Routing to replica with the lowest load, might cause read un-consistent) Datatype: string

flag.name: enable_leader_balancing
flag.meaning: Whether enable ConfigNode-leader to balance RegionGroups' leader distribution automatically. Datatype: boolean

flag.name: time_partition_interval_for_routing
flag.meaning: Cluster management Time partition interval in milliseconds, default is equal to one week Can not be changed after the first start Datatype: long

flag.name: heartbeat_interval_in_ms
flag.meaning: The heartbeat interval in milliseconds, default is 1000ms Datatype: long

flag.name: disk_space_warning_threshold
flag.meaning: Disk remaining threshold at which DataNode is set to ReadOnly status Datatype: double(percentage)

flag.name: enable_mem_control
flag.meaning: Memory Control Configuration Whether to enable memory control Datatype: boolean

flag.name: storage_query_schema_consensus_free_memory_proportion
flag.meaning: Memory Allocation Ratio: StorageEngine, QueryEngine, SchemaEngine, Consensus and Free Memory. The parameter form is a:b:c:d:e, where a, b, c, d and e are integers. for example: 1:1:1:1:1 , 6:2:1:1:1 If you have high level of writing pressure and low level of reading pressure, please adjust it to for example 6:1:1:1:2

flag.name: schema_memory_allocate_proportion
flag.meaning: Schema Memory Allocation Ratio: SchemaRegion, SchemaCache, PartitionCache and LastCache. The parameter form is a:b:c:d, where a, b, c and d are integers. for example: 1:1:1:1 , 6:2:1:1 In cluster mode, we recommend 5:3:1:1. In standalone mode, we recommend 8:1:0:1

flag.name: storage_engine_memory_proportion
flag.meaning: Memory allocation ratio in StorageEngine: Write, Compaction The parameter form is a:b:c:d, where a, b, c and d are integers. for example: 8:2 , 7:3

flag.name: write_memory_proportion
flag.meaning: Memory allocation ratio in writing: Memtable, TimePartitionInfo Memtable is the total memory size of all memtables TimePartitionInfo is the total memory size of last flush time of all data regions

flag.name: concurrent_writing_time_partition
flag.meaning: Max number of concurrent writing time partitions in one storage group This parameter is used to control total memTable number when memory control is disabled The max number of memTable is 4 * concurrent_writing_time_partition * storage group number Datatype: long

flag.name: primitive_array_size
flag.meaning: primitive array size (length of each array) in array pool Datatype: int

flag.name: chunk_metadata_size_proportion
flag.meaning: size proportion for chunk metadata maintains in memory when writing tsfile Datatype: double

flag.name: flush_proportion
flag.meaning: Ratio of write memory for invoking flush disk, 0.4 by default If you have extremely high write load (like batch=1000), it can be set lower than the default value like 0.2 Datatype: double

flag.name: buffered_arrays_memory_proportion
flag.meaning: Ratio of write memory allocated for buffered arrays, 0.6 by default Datatype: double

flag.name: reject_proportion
flag.meaning: Ratio of write memory for rejecting insertion, 0.8 by default If you have extremely high write load (like batch=1000) and the physical memory size is large enough, it can be set higher than the default value like 0.9 Datatype: double

flag.name: write_memory_variation_report_proportion
flag.meaning: If memory cost of data region increased more than proportion of allocated memory for write, report to system. The default value is 0.001 Datatype: double

flag.name: check_period_when_insert_blocked
flag.meaning: When an inserting is rejected, waiting period (in ms) to check system again, 50 by default. If the insertion has been rejected and the read load is low, it can be set larger. Datatype: int

flag.name: io_task_queue_size_for_flushing
flag.meaning: size of ioTaskQueue. The default value is 10 Datatype: int

flag.name: enable_query_memory_estimation
flag.meaning: If true, we will estimate each query's possible memory footprint before executing it and deny it if its estimated memory exceeds current free memory Datatype: bool

flag.name: schema_region_device_node_cache_size
flag.meaning: Schema Engine Configuration cache size for SchemaRegion. This cache is used to improve insert speed where all path check and TSDataType will be cached in SchemaRegion with corresponding Path. Datatype: int

flag.name: coordinator_read_executor_size
flag.meaning: thread pool size for read operation in DataNode's coordinator. Datatype: int

flag.name: coordinator_write_executor_size
flag.meaning: thread pool size for write operation in DataNode's coordinator. Datatype: int

flag.name: partition_cache_size
flag.meaning: cache size for partition. This cache is used to improve partition fetch from config node. Datatype: int

flag.name: mlog_buffer_size
flag.meaning: Size of log buffer in each metadata operation plan(in byte). If the size of a metadata operation plan is larger than this parameter, then it will be rejected by SchemaRegion If it sets a value smaller than 0, use the default value 1024*1024 Datatype: int

flag.name: sync_mlog_period_in_ms
flag.meaning: The cycle when metadata log is periodically forced to be written to disk(in milliseconds) If sync_mlog_period_in_ms=0 it means force metadata log to be written to disk after each refreshment Set this parameter to 0 may slow down the operation on slow disk.

flag.name: tag_attribute_flush_interval
flag.meaning: interval num for tag and attribute records when force flushing to disk When a certain amount of tag and attribute records is reached, they will be force flushed to disk It is possible to lose at most tag_attribute_flush_interval records

flag.name: tag_attribute_total_size
flag.meaning: max size for tag and attribute of one time series the unit is byte Datatype: int

flag.name: max_measurement_num_of_internal_request
flag.meaning: max measurement num of internal request When creating timeseries with Session.createMultiTimeseries, the user input plan, the timeseries num of which exceeds this num, will be split to several plans with timeseries no more than this num.

flag.name: enable_auto_create_schema
flag.meaning: Configurations for creating schema automatically Whether creating schema automatically is enabled If true, then create storage group and timeseries automatically when not exists in insertion Or else, user need to create storage group and timeseries before insertion. Datatype: boolean

flag.name: default_storage_group_level
flag.meaning: Storage group level when creating schema automatically is enabled e.g. root.sg0.d1.s2 we will set root.sg0 as the storage group if storage group level is 1 Datatype: int

flag.name: boolean_string_infer_type
flag.meaning: ALL data types: BOOLEAN, INT32, INT64, FLOAT, DOUBLE, TEXT register time series as which type when receiving boolean string "true" or "false" Datatype: TSDataType

flag.name: integer_string_infer_type
flag.meaning: register time series as which type when receiving an integer string "67" Datatype: TSDataType

flag.name: long_string_infer_type
flag.meaning: register time series as which type when receiving an integer string and using float may lose precision num > 2 ^ 24 Datatype: TSDataType

flag.name: floating_string_infer_type
flag.meaning: register time series as which type when receiving a floating number string "6.7" Datatype: TSDataType

flag.name: nan_string_infer_type
flag.meaning: register time series as which type when receiving the Literal NaN. Values can be DOUBLE, FLOAT or TEXT Datatype: TSDataType

flag.name: default_boolean_encoding
flag.meaning: BOOLEAN encoding when creating schema automatically is enabled Datatype: TSEncoding

flag.name: default_int32_encoding
flag.meaning: INT32 encoding when creating schema automatically is enabled Datatype: TSEncoding

flag.name: default_int64_encoding
flag.meaning: INT64 encoding when creating schema automatically is enabled Datatype: TSEncoding

flag.name: default_float_encoding
flag.meaning: FLOAT encoding when creating schema automatically is enabled Datatype: TSEncoding

flag.name: default_double_encoding
flag.meaning: DOUBLE encoding when creating schema automatically is enabled Datatype: TSEncoding

flag.name: default_text_encoding
flag.meaning: TEXT encoding when creating schema automatically is enabled Datatype: TSEncoding

flag.name: read_consistency_level
flag.meaning: Query Configurations The read consistency level These consistency levels are currently supported: 1. strong(Default, read from the leader replica) 2. weak(Read from a random replica) Datatype: string

flag.name: meta_data_cache_enable
flag.meaning: whether to cache meta data(BloomFilter, ChunkMetadata and TimeSeriesMetadata) or not. Datatype: boolean

flag.name: chunk_timeseriesmeta_free_memory_proportion
flag.meaning: Read memory Allocation Ratio: BloomFilterCache : ChunkCache : TimeSeriesMetadataCache : Coordinator : Operators : DataExchange : timeIndex in TsFileResourceList : others. The parameter form is a:b:c:d:e:f:g:h, where a, b, c, d, e, f, g and h are integers. for example: 1:1:1:1:1:1:1:1 , 1:100:200:50:200:200:200:50

flag.name: enable_last_cache
flag.meaning: Whether to enable LAST cache Datatype: boolean

flag.name: max_deduplicated_path_num
flag.meaning: allowed max numbers of deduplicated path in one query it's just an advised value, the real limitation will be the smaller one between this and the one we calculated Datatype: int

flag.name: mpp_data_exchange_core_pool_size
flag.meaning: Datatype: int

flag.name: mpp_data_exchange_max_pool_size
flag.meaning: Datatype: int

flag.name: mpp_data_exchange_keep_alive_time_in_ms
flag.meaning: Datatype: int

flag.name: default_fill_interval
flag.meaning: the default time period that used in fill query, -1 by default means infinite past time Datatype: int, Unit: ms

flag.name: group_by_fill_cache_size_in_mb
flag.meaning: Datatype: float

flag.name: driver_task_execution_time_slice_in_ms
flag.meaning: the max execution time of a DriverTask Datatype: int, Unit: ms

flag.name: max_tsblock_size_in_bytes
flag.meaning: the max capacity of a TsBlock Datatype: int, Unit: byte

flag.name: max_tsblock_line_numbers
flag.meaning: the max number of lines in a single TsBlock Datatype: int

flag.name: slow_query_threshold
flag.meaning: time cost(ms) threshold for slow query Datatype: long

flag.name: enable_external_sort
flag.meaning: Is external sort enable Datatype: boolean

flag.name: external_sort_threshold
flag.meaning: The maximum number of simultaneous chunk reading for a single time series. If the num of simultaneous chunk reading is greater than external_sort_threshold, external sorting is used. When external_sort_threshold increases, the number of chunks sorted at the same time in memory may increase and this will occupy more memory. When external_sort_threshold decreases, triggering external sorting will increase the time-consuming. Datatype: int

flag.name: timestamp_precision
flag.meaning: Storage Engine Configuration Use this value to set timestamp precision as "ms", "us" or "ns". Once the precision has been set, it can not be changed. Datatype: String

flag.name: default_ttl_in_ms
flag.meaning: Default TTL for storage groups that are not set TTL by statements, If not set (default), the TTL will be unlimited. Notice: if this property is changed, previous created storage group which are not set TTL will also be affected. data. Datatype: long Unit: ms

flag.name: max_waiting_time_when_insert_blocked
flag.meaning: When the waiting time (in ms) of an inserting exceeds this, throw an exception. 10000 by default. If the insertion has been rejected and the read load is low, it can be set larger Datatype: int

flag.name: enable_discard_out_of_order_data
flag.meaning: Add a switch to drop ouf-of-order data Out-of-order data will impact the aggregation query a lot. Users may not care about discarding some out-of-order data. Datatype: boolean

flag.name: enable_partition
flag.meaning: whether enable data partition. If disabled, all data belongs to partition 0 Datatype: boolean

flag.name: time_partition_interval_for_storage
flag.meaning: time range for partitioning data inside each data region, the unit is millisecond, default is equal to one week Datatype: long

flag.name: handle_system_error
flag.meaning: What will the system do when unrecoverable error occurs. Datatype: String Optional strategies are as follows: 1. CHANGE_TO_READ_ONLY: set system status to read-only and the system only accepts query operations. 2. SHUTDOWN: the system will be shutdown.

flag.name: memtable_size_threshold
flag.meaning: Only take effects when enable_mem_control is false. When a memTable's size (in byte) exceeds this, the memtable is flushed to disk. The default threshold is 1 GB. Datatype: long

flag.name: enable_timed_flush_seq_memtable
flag.meaning: Whether to timed flush sequence tsfiles' memtables. Datatype: boolean

flag.name: seq_memtable_flush_interval_in_ms
flag.meaning: If a memTable's created time is older than current time minus this, the memtable will be flushed to disk. Only check sequence tsfiles' memtables. The default flush interval is 60 * 60 * 1000. (unit: ms) Datatype: long

flag.name: seq_memtable_flush_check_interval_in_ms
flag.meaning: The interval to check whether sequence memtables need flushing. The default flush check interval is 10 * 60 * 1000. (unit: ms) Datatype: long

flag.name: enable_timed_flush_unseq_memtable
flag.meaning: Whether to timed flush unsequence tsfiles' memtables. Datatype: boolean

flag.name: unseq_memtable_flush_interval_in_ms
flag.meaning: If a memTable's created time is older than current time minus this, the memtable will be flushed to disk. Only check unsequence tsfiles' memtables. The default flush interval is 60 * 60 * 1000. (unit: ms) Datatype: long

flag.name: unseq_memtable_flush_check_interval_in_ms
flag.meaning: The interval to check whether unsequence memtables need flushing. The default flush check interval is 10 * 60 * 1000. (unit: ms) Datatype: long

flag.name: tvlist_sort_algorithm
flag.meaning: The sort algorithms used in the memtable's TVList TIM: default tim sort, QUICK: quick sort, BACKWARD: backward sort

flag.name: avg_series_point_number_threshold
flag.meaning: When the average point number of timeseries in memtable exceeds this, the memtable is flushed to disk. The default threshold is 100000. Datatype: int

flag.name: flush_thread_count
flag.meaning: How many threads can concurrently flush. When small= 0, use CPU core number. Datatype: int

flag.name: query_thread_count
flag.meaning: How many threads can concurrently execute query statement. When small= 0, use CPU core number. Datatype: int

flag.name: sub_rawQuery_thread_count
flag.meaning: How many threads can concurrently read data for raw data query. When small= 0, use CPU core number. Datatype: int

flag.name: raw_query_blocking_queue_capacity
flag.meaning: Blocking queue size for read task in raw data query. Must >= 1. Datatype: int

flag.name: chunk_buffer_pool_enable
flag.meaning: whether take over the memory management by IoTDB rather than JVM when serializing memtable as bytes in memory (i.e., whether use ChunkBufferPool), value true, false Datatype: boolean

flag.name: batch_size
flag.meaning: The amount of data iterate each time in server (the number of data strips, that is, the number of different timestamps.) Datatype: int

flag.name: enable_partial_insert
flag.meaning: In one insert (one device, one timestamp, multiple measurements), if enable partial insert, one measurement failure will not impact other measurements Datatype: boolean

flag.name: recovery_log_interval_in_ms
flag.meaning: the interval to log recover progress of each vsg when starting iotdb Datatype: int

flag.name: insert_multi_tablet_enable_multithreading_column_threshold
flag.meaning: When the insert plan column count reaches the specified threshold, which means that the plan is relatively large. At this time, may be enabled multithreading. If the tablet is small, the time of each insertion is short. If we enable multithreading, we also need to consider the switching loss between threads, so we need to judge the size of the tablet. Datatype: int

flag.name: upgrade_thread_count
flag.meaning: When there exists old version(0.9.x/v1) data, how many thread will be set up to perform upgrade tasks, 1 by default. Set to 1 when less than or equal to 0. Datatype: int

flag.name: enable_seq_space_compaction
flag.meaning: Compaction Configurations sequence space compaction: only compact the sequence files Datatype: boolean

flag.name: enable_unseq_space_compaction
flag.meaning: unsequence space compaction: only compact the unsequence files Datatype: boolean

flag.name: enable_cross_space_compaction
flag.meaning: cross space compaction: compact the unsequence files into the overlapped sequence files Datatype: boolean

flag.name: cross_selector
flag.meaning: the selector of cross space compaction task Options: rewrite

flag.name: cross_performer
flag.meaning: the compaction performer of cross space compaction task Options: read_point

flag.name: inner_seq_selector
flag.meaning: the selector of inner sequence space compaction task Options: size_tiered

flag.name: inner_seq_performer
flag.meaning: the performer of inner sequence space compaction task Options: read_chunk

flag.name: inner_unseq_selector
flag.meaning: the selector of inner unsequence space compaction task Options: size_tiered

flag.name: inner_unseq_performer
flag.meaning: the performer of inner unsequence space compaction task Options: read_point

flag.name: compaction_priority
flag.meaning: The priority of compaction execution INNER_CROSS: prioritize inner space compaction, reduce the number of files first CROSS_INNER: prioritize cross space compaction, eliminate the unsequence files first BALANCE: alternate two compaction types

flag.name: target_compaction_file_size
flag.meaning: The target tsfile size in compaction Datatype: long, Unit: byte

flag.name: target_chunk_size
flag.meaning: The target chunk size in compaction and when memtable reaches this threshold, flush the memtable to disk. default is 1MB Datatype: long, Unit: byte

flag.name: target_chunk_point_num
flag.meaning: The target point nums in one chunk in compaction Datatype: long

flag.name: chunk_size_lower_bound_in_compaction
flag.meaning: If the chunk size is lower than this threshold, it will be deserialize into points, default is 128 byte Datatype: long, Unit:byte

flag.name: chunk_point_num_lower_bound_in_compaction
flag.meaning: If the chunk size is lower than this threshold, it will be deserialize into points Datatype: long

flag.name: max_inner_compaction_candidate_file_num
flag.meaning: The max file when selecting inner space compaction candidate files Datatype: int

flag.name: max_cross_compaction_candidate_file_num
flag.meaning: The max file when selecting cross space compaction candidate files At least one unseq file with it's overlapped seq files will be selected even exceeded this number Datatype: int

flag.name: max_cross_compaction_candidate_file_size
flag.meaning: The max total size when selecting cross space compaction candidate files At least one unseq file with it's overlapped seq files will be selected even exceeded this number Datatype: long, Unit: byte

flag.name: cross_compaction_file_selection_time_budget
flag.meaning: If one merge file selection runs for more than this time, it will be ended and its current selection will be used as final selection. When small 0, it means time is unbounded. Datatype: long, Unit: ms

flag.name: compaction_thread_count
flag.meaning: How many threads will be set up to perform compaction, 10 by default. Set to 1 when less than or equal to 0. Datatype: int

flag.name: compaction_schedule_interval_in_ms
flag.meaning: The interval of compaction task schedule Datatype: long, Unit: ms

flag.name: compaction_submission_interval_in_ms
flag.meaning: The interval of compaction task submission Datatype: long, Unit: ms

flag.name: compaction_write_throughput_mb_per_sec
flag.meaning: The limit of write throughput merge can reach per second Datatype: int

flag.name: query_timeout_threshold
flag.meaning: The max executing time of query. unit: ms Datatype: int

flag.name: max_allowed_concurrent_queries
flag.meaning: The maximum allowed concurrently executing queries Datatype: int

flag.name: sub_compaction_thread_count
flag.meaning: The number of sub compaction threads to be set up to perform compaction. Currently only works for nonAligned data in cross space compaction and unseq inner space compaction. Set to 1 when less than or equal to 0. Datatype: int

flag.name: wal_mode
flag.meaning: Write Ahead Log Configuration Write mode of wal The details of these three modes are as follows: 1. DISABLE: the system will disable wal. 2. SYNC: the system will submit wal synchronously, write request will not return until its wal is fsynced to the disk successfully. 3. ASYNC: the system will submit wal asynchronously, write request will return immediately no matter its wal is fsynced to the disk successfully. The write performance order is DISABLE > ASYNC > SYNC, but only SYNC mode can ensure data durability.

flag.name: max_wal_nodes_num
flag.meaning: Max number of wal nodes, each node corresponds to one wal directory The default value 0 means the number is determined by the system. Notice: this value affects write performance significantly. For non-SSD disks, values between one third and half of storage groups number are recommended. Datatype: int

flag.name: fsync_wal_delay_in_ms
flag.meaning: Duration a wal flush operation will wait before calling fsync A duration greater than 0 batches multiple wal fsync calls into one. This is useful when disks are slow or WAL write contention exists. Notice: this value affects write performance significantly, values in the range of 0ms-10ms are recommended. Datatype: long

flag.name: wal_buffer_size_in_byte
flag.meaning: Buffer size of each wal node If it's a value smaller than 0, use the default value 16 * 1024 * 1024 bytes (16MB). Datatype: int

flag.name: wal_buffer_queue_capacity
flag.meaning: Blocking queue capacity of each wal buffer, restricts maximum number of WALEdits cached in the blocking queue. Datatype: int

flag.name: wal_file_size_threshold_in_byte
flag.meaning: Size threshold of each wal file When a wal file's size exceeds this, the wal file will be closed and a new wal file will be created. If it's a value smaller than 0, use the default value 10 * 1024 * 1024 (10MB). Datatype: long

flag.name: wal_min_effective_info_ratio
flag.meaning: Minimum ratio of effective information in wal files This value should be between 0.0 and 1.0 If effective information ratio is below this value, MemTable snapshot or flush will be triggered. Increase this value when wal occupies too much disk space. But, if this parameter is too large, the write performance may decline. Datatype: double

flag.name: wal_memtable_snapshot_threshold_in_byte
flag.meaning: MemTable size threshold for triggering MemTable snapshot in wal When a memTable's size (in byte) exceeds this, wal can flush this memtable to disk, otherwise wal will snapshot this memtable in wal. If it's a value smaller than 0, use the default value 8 * 1024 * 1024 bytes (8MB). Datatype: long

flag.name: max_wal_memtable_snapshot_num
flag.meaning: MemTable's max snapshot number in wal If one memTable's snapshot number in wal exceeds this value, it will be flushed to disk. Datatype: int

flag.name: delete_wal_files_period_in_ms
flag.meaning: The period when outdated wal files are periodically deleted If this value is too large, outdated wal files may not able to be deleted in time. If it's a value smaller than 0, use the default value 20 * 1000 ms (20 seconds). Datatype: long

flag.name: multi_leader_throttle_threshold_in_byte
flag.meaning: The minimum size of wal files when throttle down in MultiLeader consensus If it's a value smaller than 0, use the default value 50 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024 bytes (50GB). Datatype: long

flag.name: multi_leader_cache_window_time_in_ms
flag.meaning: Maximum wait time of write cache in MultiLeader consensus If this value is less than or equal to 0, use the default value Long.MAX_VALUE. Datatype: long

flag.name: group_size_in_byte
flag.meaning: TsFile Configurations Datatype: int

flag.name: page_size_in_byte
flag.meaning: The memory size for each series writer to pack page, default value is 64KB Datatype: int

flag.name: max_number_of_points_in_page
flag.meaning: The maximum number of data points in a page, default 1024*1024 Datatype: int

flag.name: pattern_matching_threshold
flag.meaning: The threshold for pattern matching in regex Datatype: int

flag.name: max_string_length
flag.meaning: Max size limitation of input string Datatype: int

flag.name: float_precision
flag.meaning: Floating-point precision Datatype: int

flag.name: time_encoder
flag.meaning: Encoder configuration Encoder of time series, supports TS_2DIFF, PLAIN and RLE(run-length encoding), REGULAR and default value is TS_2DIFF

flag.name: value_encoder
flag.meaning: Encoder of value series. default value is PLAIN. For int, long data type, also supports TS_2DIFF and RLE(run-length encoding), GORILLA and ZIGZAG.

flag.name: compressor
flag.meaning: Compression configuration Data compression method, supports UNCOMPRESSED, SNAPPY or LZ4. Default value is SNAPPY

flag.name: max_degree_of_index_node
flag.meaning: Maximum degree of a metadataIndex node, default value is 256 Datatype: int

flag.name: frequency_interval_in_minute
flag.meaning: time interval in minute for calculating query frequency Datatype: int

flag.name: freq_snr
flag.meaning: Signal-noise-ratio (SNR) of FREQ encoding Datatype: double

flag.name: freq_block_size
flag.meaning: Block size of FREQ encoding Datatype: integer

flag.name: watermark_module_opened
flag.meaning: Watermark Configuration Datatype: boolean

flag.name: watermark_secret_key
flag.meaning: Datatype: String

flag.name: watermark_bit_string
flag.meaning: Datatype: String

flag.name: watermark_method
flag.meaning: Datatype: String

flag.name: authorizer_provider_class
flag.meaning: Authorization Configuration which class to serve for authorization. By default, it is LocalFileAuthorizer. Another choice is org.apache.iotdb.db.auth.authorizer.OpenIdAuthorizer

flag.name: admin_name
flag.meaning: If OpenIdAuthorizer is enabled, then openID_url must be set. openID_url= admin username, default is root Datatype: string

flag.name: iotdb_server_encrypt_decrypt_provider
flag.meaning: encryption provider class

flag.name: admin_password
flag.meaning: encryption provided class parameter iotdb_server_encrypt_decrypt_provider_parameter= admin password, default is root Datatype: string

flag.name: author_cache_size
flag.meaning: Cache size of user and role Datatype: int

flag.name: author_cache_expire_time
flag.meaning: Cache expire time of user and role Datatype: int

flag.name: udf_initial_byte_array_length_for_memory_control
flag.meaning: UDF Configuration Used to estimate the memory usage of text fields in a UDF query. It is recommended to set this value to be slightly larger than the average length of all text records. Datatype: int

flag.name: udf_memory_budget_in_mb
flag.meaning: How much memory may be used in ONE UDF query (in MB). The upper limit is 20% of allocated memory for read. Datatype: float

flag.name: udf_reader_transformer_collector_memory_proportion
flag.meaning: UDF memory allocation ratio. The parameter form is a:b:c, where a, b, and c are integers.

flag.name: udf_lib_dir
flag.meaning: UDF lib dir If this property is unset, system will save the data in the default relative path directory under the UDF folder(i.e., %CONFIGNODE_HOME%/ext/udf). If it is absolute, system will save the data in exact location it points to. If it is relative, system will save the data in the relative path directory it indicates under the UDF folder. Note: If data_dir is assigned an empty string(i.e.,zero-size), it will be handled as a relative path. For Window platform If its prefix is a drive specifier followed by "\\", or if its prefix is "\\\\", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative. udf_lib_dir=ext\\udf For Linux platform If its prefix is "/", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative.

flag.name: trigger_lib_dir
flag.meaning: Trigger Configuration Uncomment the following field to configure the trigger lib directory. For Window platform If its prefix is a drive specifier followed by "\\", or if its prefix is "\\\\", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative. trigger_lib_dir=ext\\trigger For Linux platform If its prefix is "/", then the path is absolute. Otherwise, it is relative.

flag.name: window_evaluation_thread_count
flag.meaning: How many threads can be used for evaluating sliding windows. When small= 0, use CPU core number. Datatype: int

flag.name: max_pending_window_evaluation_tasks
flag.meaning: Max number of window evaluation tasks that can be pending for execution. When small= 0, the value is 64 by default. Datatype: int

flag.name: stateful_trigger_retry_num_when_not_found
flag.meaning: How many times will we retry to found an instance of stateful trigger on DataNodes 3 by default. Datatype: int

flag.name: trigger_forward_max_queue_number
flag.meaning: Number of queues per forwarding trigger

flag.name: trigger_forward_max_size_per_queue
flag.meaning: The length of one of the queues per forwarding trigger

flag.name: trigger_forward_batch_size
flag.meaning: Trigger forwarding data size per batch

flag.name: trigger_forward_http_pool_size
flag.meaning: Trigger HTTP forward pool size

flag.name: trigger_forward_http_pool_max_per_route
flag.meaning: Trigger HTTP forward pool max connection for per route

flag.name: trigger_forward_mqtt_pool_size
flag.meaning: Trigger MQTT forward pool size

flag.name: select_into_insert_tablet_plan_row_limit
flag.meaning: Select-Into Configuration The maximum number of rows can be processed in insert-tablet-plan when executing select-into statements. When small= 0, use 10000. Datatype: int

flag.name: max_pending_continuous_query_tasks
flag.meaning: Continuous Query Configuration Maximum number of continuous query tasks that can be pending for execution. When small= 0, the value is 64 by default. Datatype: int

flag.name: cqlog_buffer_size
flag.meaning: The size of log buffer for every CQ management operation plan. If the size of a CQ management operation plan is larger than this parameter, the CQ management operation plan will be rejected by CQManager. Datatype: int

flag.name: continuous_query_submit_thread_count
flag.meaning: The number of threads in the scheduled thread pool that submit continuous query tasks periodically Datatype: int

flag.name: continuous_query_min_every_interval_in_ms
flag.meaning: The minimum value of the continuous query execution time interval Datatype: long(duration)

flag.name: ip_white_list
flag.meaning: PIPE Configuration White IP list of Sync client. Please use the form of network segment to present the range of IP, for example: 192.168.0.0/16 If there are more than one IP segment, please separate them by commas The default is to allow all IP to sync Datatype: String

flag.name: max_number_of_sync_file_retry
flag.meaning: The maximum number of retry when syncing a file to receiver fails.

flag.name: session_timeout_threshold
flag.meaning: Connection Configuration The maximum session idle time. unit: ms Idle sessions are the ones that performs neither query or non-query operations for a period of time Set to 0 to disable session timeout Datatype: int

flag.name: rpc_thrift_compression_enable
flag.meaning: Datatype: boolean

flag.name: rpc_advanced_compression_enable
flag.meaning: if true, a snappy based compression method will be called before sending data by the network Datatype: boolean this feature is under development, set this as false before it is done.

flag.name: rpc_selector_thread_count
flag.meaning: Datatype: int

flag.name: rpc_min_concurrent_client_num
flag.meaning: Datatype: int

flag.name: rpc_max_concurrent_client_num
flag.meaning: Datatype: int

flag.name: thrift_max_frame_size
flag.meaning: thrift max frame size, 512MB by default Datatype: int

flag.name: thrift_init_buffer_size
flag.meaning: thrift init buffer size Datatype: int

flag.name: connection_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: Thrift socket and connection timeout between raft nodes, in milliseconds. Datatype: int

flag.name: core_connection_for_internal_service
flag.meaning: The maximum number of clients that can be idle for a node's InternalService. When the number of idle clients on a node exceeds this number, newly returned clients will be released Datatype: int

flag.name: max_connection_for_internal_service
flag.meaning: The maximum number of clients that can be applied for a node's InternalService Datatype: int

flag.name: selector_thread_count_of_client_manager
flag.meaning: selector thread (TAsyncClientManager) nums for async thread in a clientManager Datatype: int

flag.name: config_node_ratis_log_appender_buffer_size_max
flag.meaning: RatisConsensus Configuration max payload size for a single log-sync-RPC from leader to follower

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_log_appender_buffer_size_max
flag.meaning: max payload size for a single log-sync-RPC from leader to follower

flag.name: data_region_ratis_log_appender_buffer_size_max
flag.meaning: max payload size for a single log-sync-RPC from leader to follower

flag.name: config_node_ratis_snapshot_trigger_threshold
flag.meaning: trigger a snapshot when snapshot_trigger_threshold logs are written

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_snapshot_trigger_threshold
flag.meaning: trigger a snapshot when snapshot_trigger_threshold logs are written

flag.name: data_region_ratis_snapshot_trigger_threshold
flag.meaning: trigger a snapshot when snapshot_trigger_threshold logs are written

flag.name: config_node_simple_consensus_snapshot_trigger_threshold
flag.meaning: trigger a snapshot when snapshot_trigger_threshold logs are written

flag.name: config_node_ratis_log_unsafe_flush_enable
flag.meaning: allow flushing Raft Log asynchronously

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_log_unsafe_flush_enable
flag.meaning: allow flushing Raft Log asynchronously

flag.name: data_region_ratis_log_unsafe_flush_enable
flag.meaning: allow flushing Raft Log asynchronously

flag.name: config_node_ratis_log_segment_size_max_in_byte
flag.meaning: max capacity of a single Log segment file (in byte, by default 24MB)

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_log_segment_size_max_in_byte
flag.meaning: max capacity of a single Log segment file (in byte, by default 24MB)

flag.name: data_region_ratis_log_segment_size_max_in_byte
flag.meaning: max capacity of a single Log segment file (in byte, by default 24MB)

flag.name: config_node_simple_consensus_log_segment_size_max_in_byte
flag.meaning: max capacity of a single Log segment file (in byte, by default 24MB)

flag.name: config_node_ratis_grpc_flow_control_window
flag.meaning: flow control window for ratis grpc log appender

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_grpc_flow_control_window
flag.meaning: flow control window for ratis grpc log appender

flag.name: data_region_ratis_grpc_flow_control_window
flag.meaning: flow control window for ratis grpc log appender

flag.name: config_node_ratis_rpc_leader_election_timeout_min_ms
flag.meaning: min election timeout for leader election

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_rpc_leader_election_timeout_min_ms
flag.meaning: min election timeout for leader election

flag.name: data_region_ratis_rpc_leader_election_timeout_min_ms
flag.meaning: min election timeout for leader election

flag.name: config_node_ratis_rpc_leader_election_timeout_max_ms
flag.meaning: max election timeout for leader election

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_rpc_leader_election_timeout_max_ms
flag.meaning: max election timeout for leader election

flag.name: data_region_ratis_rpc_leader_election_timeout_max_ms
flag.meaning: max election timeout for leader election

flag.name: config_node_ratis_request_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: ratis client retry threshold

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_request_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: ratis client retry threshold

flag.name: data_region_ratis_request_timeout_ms
flag.meaning: ratis client retry threshold

flag.name: config_node_ratis_max_retry_attempts
flag.meaning: currently we use exponential back-off retry policy for ratis

flag.name: config_node_ratis_initial_sleep_time_ms
flag.meaning: currently we use exponential back-off retry policy for ratis

flag.name: config_node_ratis_max_sleep_time_ms
flag.meaning: currently we use exponential back-off retry policy for ratis

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_max_retry_attempts
flag.meaning: currently we use exponential back-off retry policy for ratis

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_initial_sleep_time_ms
flag.meaning: currently we use exponential back-off retry policy for ratis

flag.name: data_region_ratis_max_retry_attempts

flag.name: data_region_ratis_initial_sleep_time_ms
flag.meaning: currently we use exponential back-off retry policy for ratis

flag.name: data_region_ratis_max_sleep_time_ms
flag.meaning: currently we use exponential back-off retry policy for ratis

flag.name: config_node_ratis_preserve_logs_num_when_purge
flag.meaning: preserve certain logs when take snapshot and purge

flag.name: schema_region_ratis_preserve_logs_num_when_purge
flag.meaning: preserve certain logs when take snapshot and purge

flag.name: data_region_ratis_preserve_logs_num_when_purge
flag.meaning: preserve certain logs when take snapshot and purge

flag.name: ratis_first_election_timeout_min_ms
flag.meaning: first election timeout

flag.name: ratis_first_election_timeout_max_ms
flag.meaning: first election timeout

flag.name: procedure_core_worker_thread_count
flag.meaning: Procedure Configuration Default number of worker thread count Datatype: int

flag.name: procedure_completed_clean_interval
flag.meaning: Default time interval of completed procedure cleaner work in, time unit is second Datatype: int

flag.name: procedure_completed_evict_ttl
flag.meaning: Default ttl of completed procedure, time unit is second Datatype: int

flag.name: enable_mqtt_service
flag.meaning: MQTT Broker Configuration whether to enable the mqtt service. Datatype: boolean

flag.name: mqtt_host
flag.meaning: the mqtt service binding host. Datatype: String

flag.name: mqtt_port
flag.meaning: the mqtt service binding port. Datatype: int

flag.name: mqtt_handler_pool_size
flag.meaning: the handler pool size for handing the mqtt messages. Datatype: int

flag.name: mqtt_payload_formatter
flag.meaning: the mqtt message payload formatter. Datatype: String

flag.name: mqtt_max_message_size
flag.meaning: max length of mqtt message in byte Datatype: int

flag.name: enable_influxdb_rpc_service
flag.meaning: InfluxDB RPC Service Configuration Datatype: boolean

flag.name: influxdb_rpc_port
flag.meaning: Datatype: int

flag.name: MAX_HEAP_SIZE
flag.meaning: Maximum heap size

flag.name: HEAP_NEWSIZE
flag.meaning: Minimum heap size

flag.name: MAX_HEAP_SIZE
flag.meaning: Maximum heap size

flag.name: MAX_HEAP_SIZE
flag.meaning: Maximum heap size
